instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power, Charger light okay.
threads.message:
Customer said they returned from holiday and it was dead.

Green & Orange light behave as expected. I can hear a soft ticking when I connect power.

Only corrosion was on <CAPACITOR>C3532</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7518</CAPACITOR> was corroded off the board.

I get 40mV at <RESISTOR>R7547</RESISTOR>::1 & ::2.

PPBus = 8.59v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is up and down like a yoyo.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is the same.

PP3v42 is 3.4v as expected from the light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power, Charger light okay.
threads.message:
Going to replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

Solid power going in, and everything coming out of it is fluctuating.
